name: Banana Walnut Bread - Gluten free Banana Bread
description: This Banana Walnut Breakfast Loaf makes a great on the go breakfast. Bananas, spices and no added refined sugar. Free of Dairy, egg, corn, soy, gluten. Makes a medium bread pan.
recipeIngredient: 2-3 Tbsp maple syrup  (depends on the ripeness of the banana)
1/4 cup amaranth flour (or sorghum or millet or use half flour and half starch for lighter loaf.)

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Pre-heat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the bananas well. then mix in all the wet ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash the bananas well. then mix in all the wet ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients. Add to the wet and mix to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients. Add to the wet and mix to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the walnuts. Drop the batter in a greased pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the walnuts. Drop the batter in a greased pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Even it out and bake for 40 minutes.Check with a toothpick from the center. it should come out almost clean. Bake longer if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Even it out and bake for 40 minutes.Check with a toothpick from the center. it should come out almost clean. Bake longer if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: I used very ripe bananas. Use stevia/sugar to preference if the bananas are not sweet enough for the loaf. Or if the loaf is already baked and not sweet enough, serve warm with light maple drizzle.
recipeInstructions.name: I used very ripe bananas. Use stevia/sugar to preference if the bananas are not sweet enough for the loaf. Or if the loaf is already baked and not sweet enough, serve warm with light maple drizzle.
